definition: A term used to describe the connection or relationship between two or more entities, often referring to the way they interact, relate, or stand in relation to each other. It is commonly used to discuss personal, social, or professional relationships, as well as the proportions, ratios, or proportions between different elements or factors.

examples.german: Das Verhältnis zwischen den beiden Ländern ist angespannt.
examples.english: The relationship between the two countries is tense.

examples.german: Sie haben ein gutes Verhältnis zueinander.
examples.english: They have a good relationship with each other.

examples.german: Das Verhältnis von Preis und Leistung ist sehr gut.
examples.english: The price-performance ratio is very good.

examples.german: Er hat ein inniges Verhältnis zu seiner Familie.
examples.english: He has a close relationship with his family.

examples.german: Das Verhältnis der beiden Unternehmen ist geschäftlich.
examples.english: The relationship between the two companies is business-related.
